definition: to show an effect/to produce an effect/a conspicuous effect

sentences.english: The liver blood reduced obviously compared with that before treatment.
sentences.chinese: 肝硬變治療後顯效者肝血流量較治療前下降明顯。

sentences.english: But this process took a long time, and its effects were not obvious until the Tang dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 這一過程歷時彌久，至唐初才見顯效。

sentences.english: Time and in the markedly effective efficacy against Mycoplasma is also better than the control group.
sentences.chinese: 在顯效時間及對支原體療效方面亦優於對照組。

definition: to accompany/(of a doctor etc) to do a follow-up (on a patient, client etc)
treatment involving the use of tonics to restore the patient's health/reinforcing method (in acupuncture)
(TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion

pinyin: feng1 shi1 xing4 guan1 jie2 yan2
